column10: Messaggui
First briefing with the laboratory Wuhan Institute of Virology. Objective: develop a highly lethal viral strain with airborne transmission vectors. Projected deaths: 5 million in the first year.
Allocated budget: $250 million. Designated project: Project Dawn. Guidelines: global compatibility, 20% lethality, and 80% transmissibility.
New in vitro test. Preliminary results promising: the vector shows lethal effectiveness on immunocompromised subjects under variable climatic conditions.
Confirmation received: the strain is ready for animal testing. Integration with outlined quarantine and economic lockdown strategies.

column4: The Man in the High Castle
column10: Target timeline: global release scheduled for December 2019. Synchronization with PR teams required to minimize initial suspicion.

column4: The Man in the High Castle
column10: Initial distribution confirmed. Asian port channels will be used as primary hubs. Objective: rapid spread in densely populated areas.
Viral strain activated. PR team ready for the official narrative on the 'sudden pandemic.' Projected subscription increase: 18% in the first quarter.
Expected 60% increase in subscriptions by Q2 2020. Isolation scenarios could generate $4 billion in profits within the semester.
Global lockdowns confirmed. Projected profits: +45% subscriptions in Q2. Intensify Stay at Home campaigns to maximize panic.
Lockdowns extended globally. 120% growth in family engagement, with peaks in children’s content and pandemic dramas.
Positive results in Europe and the USA. User engagement increased by 72%. Next phase: promoting content that emphasizes ongoing risks.
Announce donation for vaccine research. Objective: strengthen public image and legitimize gains derived from restrictions.
Economic impact report: $7 billion increase in revenue. Estimated human losses: 10 million. Acceptable variable.
Consideration of new strains. Potential use to keep pandemic dynamics active in Q3, with more lethal mutations.
Analysis of possible mutations. Objective: develop strains resistant to initial vaccines to ensure long-term control and new lockdowns.
Financial projections show a record $30 billion profit in the first semester. Each estimated death has generated $50,000 in new profits.
The psychological impact of lockdowns has strengthened user loyalty. New subscriptions remain stable despite the easing of restrictions.
Final analysis cycle completed. Operational trace removal required by Q4 2022 to avoid retroactive investigations.
Archiving completed. Pandemic declared over. Focus on user consolidation and long-term loyalty.
Continue monitoring the relaxation of restrictions. Opportunity to consolidate domestic consumption habits even in a post-pandemic context.
Advanced planning for more aggressive variants. Target: double mortality in vulnerable groups within the next quarter.
Revised budget: increased to $300 million for media management tools and improved viral strains.
New climate tests: the vector remains stable at extreme temperatures, ensuring global transmissibility.
Approval received to begin human experiments in controlled environments. Expected increase in scientific data within three months.
Updated communication strategy: emphasize risk to ensure global cooperation in lockdowns.
Secondary hubs in Latin America activated to ensure widespread distribution of the strain.
Updated report: increased engagement in emerging markets. Profit projections revised upward by 25%.
Focus on crisis narratives in original content. Objective: increase users' emotional involvement.
Development of fear-driven campaigns to maximize dependency on our services.
Growth in user trust in our content: 89% consider our narratives reliable.
Significant increase in viewership data during infection peaks.
Updated PR strategy: position donations as a signal of global moral leadership.
Operational coordination in Asia completed. Expansion needed toward Europe and North America.
Preliminary study of new strains aimed at extending the duration of global health crises.
Proposal to develop strains with evolutionary resistance to second-generation vaccines.
Updated profit forecasts: $50 billion by the end of the pandemic.
Monitoring social reactions: reinforce the narrative on the inevitability of pandemic events.
Data sanitization operations underway. Completion expected by the end of 2022.
Creation of plans to maintain high health risk perception for the next five years.
Focus on strategies for permanent domestic consumption. Opportunity to launch new subscription services.
